author: bridge-bot
content:
<fede_intern> re: **@parithoshj**
> From Matty:
individual payload observations are now exposed on The Lab](https://lab.ethpandaops.io/ethereum/execution/payloads. Direct linking to the corresponding blocks. Reach out if you've got questions or want help digging into the data.

There's a filter for reference nodes, so we can use this as a way to figure out which exact blocks are bad on reference machines on mainnet and then convert those into new benchmarks and eventually stateful tests.
@parithoshj how can we integrate ethrex here?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<savidtech> re: **@parithoshj**
> We‚Äôre missing a nuc for running ethrexüòÖ
The infra is in Sydney, we‚Äôre discussing what we have to reorg to get a 6th one in. Will probably take post holidays to get that reference machine in.

I‚Äôm not sure what needs doing for contributoor stats though
we have a PR to geth extending ethstats client (https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/33395) to emit a new timing event around engine_newPayload.

the end goal is for ethpandaops to run a ethstats server to collect block times from contributoors (opt in) and anyone else who wants to send us el timing data. 

i haven't looked into other client implementations yet, feed back from other client teams much appreciated
